DOC.brief_summary: This four-and-a-half-year study test efficacy view theoretically base culturally sensitive video follow group discussion ( vs. single viewing ) increase mammography use . The result study lead cancer control effort effectively decrease breast cancer screen disparity experience Chinese-America woman .
DOC.detailed_description: We conduct 4.5-year community-based RCT study impact intervention approach ( small-group video discussion vs. single video mode ) mammography use among Chinese immigrant woman . The small-group video discussion lead trained Chinese community health educator train bilingual research staff use standardize structure protocol site . In single video mode , mail intervention material woman view and/or read home . We recruit 974 Chinese woman strong well-established Chinese community partnership metropolitan area Washington , DC ( Lead PI : Dr. Judy Wang , Georgetown University-GU ) , New York ( Site PI : Dr. Grace Ma Temple University ) , southern California ( Site PI : Dr. Annette Maxwell , University California , Los Angeles-UCLA ) . Participants ' eligibility list `` eligibility criterion '' . We enroll US-born Chinese woman least likely face cultural language barrier mammography less likely engage small-group discussion , conduct Chinese language . Also , enroll short-term visitor study involve four interview 2-year period .
DOC.criteria: 1 . First generation Chinese woman 2 . Aged 42 old 3 . Have mammogram past 2 year 4 . Have never breast cancer 5 . Lived metropolitan DC , southern CA , NY suburb ; AND 6 . Have mammography screen schedule next 6 month time enrollment 1 . Shortterm visitor 2 . USborn Chinese Americans
